description: This course introduces basic concepts for building web pages using HTML which gives structure to the content such as defining paragraphs and images and CSS which defines the appearance of the content such as colors and fonts. It also introduces bootstrap which is a collection of tools and templates for use with HTML and CSS.
descriptionMD: This course introduces basic concepts for building web pages using HTML which gives structure to the content such as defining paragraphs and images and CSS which defines the appearance of the content such as colors and fonts. It also introduces bootstrap which is a collection of tools and templates for use with HTML and CSS.
name: HTML, CSS and Bootstrap
subtitle: Responsive Web Design

episodes.description: This course introduces basic concepts for building web pages using HTML which gives structure to the content such as defining paragraphs and images and CSS which defines the appearance of the content such as colors and fonts. It also introduces bootstrap which is a collection of tools and templates for use with HTML and CSS.
episodes.title: Overview
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:10.000
[MUSIC]

2
00:00:13.583 --> 00:00:14.370
Hello.

3
00:00:14.370 --> 00:00:18.230
In this series of videos,
we're gonna be looking at HTML, CSS, and

4
00:00:18.230 --> 00:00:21.750
Bootstrap ,and here to tell us a little
bit more about what we can expect,

5
00:00:21.750 --> 00:00:23.640
here's Mr. Victor Moreno.

6
00:00:23.640 --> 00:00:24.920
>> Thank you, Mike.

7
00:00:24.920 --> 00:00:28.290
Basically, the series is aimed for anybody

8
00:00:28.290 --> 00:00:32.240
who wants to understand a little bit about
what HTML is and how to make websites.

9
00:00:32.240 --> 00:00:34.210
We talk about what websites even are.

10
00:00:34.210 --> 00:00:36.402
What your browser really
does behind the scenes.

11
00:00:36.402 --> 00:00:39.830
How to dig under the hood of your browser,
how to understand what's going on with

12
00:00:39.830 --> 00:00:44.550
HTML, how to apply CSS, how to manage
your files in a professional way, and

13
00:00:44.550 --> 00:00:49.000
how to use third party tools that make
your development process a lot easier.

14
00:00:49.000 --> 00:00:52.890
And if you look at my screen right now,
we can actually, by the end of the course,

15
00:00:52.890 --> 00:00:55.950
over a couple of episodes,
we actually make this website right here

16
00:00:55.950 --> 00:01:00.810
with a slider, some nice pictures,
some icons, a contact form.

17
00:01:00.810 --> 00:01:04.500
And we talk about how all of this works,
and what all of it does.

18
00:01:04.500 --> 00:01:09.217
So, hopefully, you stay tuned, and
hopefully you enjoy it and learn a lot.

19
00:01:09.217 --> 00:01:16.389
[MUSIC]

episodes.description: In this episode, Victor and Mike explain the basics of HTML and CSS. They go over how a browser requests and interprets a web page and how to use the browser to look under the hood of a web page. They also talk about tools like Bootstrap and Atom.
episodes.title: Introduction to HTML

episodes.description: In this episode, Victor and Mike start by looking at different elements that make up an HTML document. They look at inserting images, explaining relative and absolute paths. Then they begin their look at CSS, demonstrating how to link a style sheet.
episodes.title: CSS

episodes.description: In this episode, Victor and Mike continue their discussion on CSS. They look at different ways to style an HTML element, using classes, IDs, and tags. They also explain the CSS box model.
episodes.title: CSS Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Victor and Mike explain the concept of responsive web design. They demonstrate using the Bootstrap framework to design a web page using a responsive grid layout. They also talk about the concept of using a content delivery network (CDN).
episodes.title: Responsive Web Design

episodes.description: In this episode, Victor and Mike put it all together and build a web page. They build a page with a navbar, a slider/carousel, a 3-column responsive section, a 2-column responsive section with a form, and a footer with social media icons.
episodes.title: Building a Bootstrap Page

episodes.description: In this episode, Victor and Mike look at using forms in a web page. They demonstrate creating a form, explaining the different form elements. They also look at glyphs, and how to use them in your web design.
episodes.title: Glyphs and Forms

episodes.description: In this episode, Victor and Mike talk about more advanced CSS selectors and how to use an icon library. They demonstrate creating compound CSS selectors and explain how they work. They also show how to link to an icon library, like FontAwesome, and insert icons into a web page.
episodes.title: Font Awesome
